title: How to Make Khichadi with Rice and Moong Dal

methods.name: Cleaning the Rice and Split Pea Gram

steps.headline: Pour the rice into a large mixing bowl.
Add the split green gram to the rice.
Clean and wash the mixture of rice and green gram under running water.
Add ghee to the base of a pressure cooker.
Add cumin seeds.
steps.description: Cook over low heat until they splutter.

steps.headline: Sprinkle asafoetida powder over the seeds.
Remove the water from the rice and green gram.
Add the washed rice and green gram to the pressure cooker.
Mix well with the spatula.
steps.description: Fry for a few minutes till the ghee covers the rice and green gram.

steps.headline: Add water.
steps.description: The level should be above the mixture of rice and green gram.

steps.headline: Cover the lid of the pressure cooker.
steps.description: Cook under pressure till there are two whistles (approximately six minutes of cooking under pressure).

steps.headline: Open the lid of the pressure cooker.
steps.description: Check whether the rice grains and green gram pulses are cooked enough.

steps.headline: Add more water to get a thick consistency without separating the grains.
steps.description: Cook for a few minutes more.

tyn: Pressure cooker (preferably traditional Indian style, otherwise your usual pressure cooker)
text: Cleaning the Rice and Split Pea Gram Pour the rice into a large mixing bowl.  Add the split green gram to the rice.  Clean and wash the mixture of rice and green gram under running water.  Frying with Ghee Add ghee to the base of a pressure cooker.  Add cumin seeds. Cook over low heat until they splutter. Sprinkle asafoetida powder over the seeds. Mix well. Add turmeric powder and mix.  Remove the water from the rice and green gram.  Add the washed rice and green gram to the pressure cooker.  Mix well with the spatula. Fry for a few minutes till the ghee covers the rice and green gram. Add water. The level should be above the mixture of rice and green gram. Pressure Cooking Cover the lid of the pressure cooker. Cook under pressure till there are two whistles (approximately six minutes of cooking under pressure). Turn off the heat source. Let the pressure settle down. Open the lid of the pressure cooker. Check whether the rice grains and green gram pulses are cooked enough. Add more water to get a thick consistency without separating the grains. Cook for a few minutes more. Add salt and mix well.  Serve with curds or pickle. Add ghee before serving.
